senses.de: The act or state of being calm and not worried
senses.ex: The spa is a place of relaxation.

Tips.title: Emotional State
Tips.description: Often used when describing emotional relief or escaping stress.
Tips.example: After finals week, I needed some relaxation.

Tips.title: Not Always Idle
Tips.description: Relaxation doesn't mean doing nothing; activities can be relaxing too.
Tips.example: Gardening is my go-to relaxation activity.

senses.de: Something that you do to rest or enjoy yourself
senses.ex: Listening to classical music is her favorite form of relaxation.

Tips.title: Subjective Variety
Tips.description: What one finds relaxing, another may not. It's personal preference.
Tips.example: For some, cooking is a great relaxation method.

senses.de: A way of reducing stiffness or tension in a part of the body
senses.ex: The physical therapist will teach you muscle relaxation techniques.

Tips.title: Health Context
Tips.description: In medical or wellness contexts, it refers to physical tension reduction.
Tips.example: Regular relaxation exercises can help manage chronic pain.

Tips.title: Beyond Massage
Tips.description: It's not just massage; relaxation can involve breathing exercises and more.

senses.de: The act or process of becoming less strict or severe
senses.ex: There has been a relaxation of the laws regarding cannabis in some states.

Tips.title: Regulations and Rules
Tips.description: In legal and policy contexts, implies making rules less rigid or strict.
Tips.example: The relaxation of visa rules boosted tourism.

Tips.title: Not Always Positive
Tips.description: Relaxation of standards or rules isn't always viewed positively.
Tips.example: Critics argue that the relaxation of bank regulations could lead to another financial crisis.

senses.de: In physics, the return of a system to equilibrium after a disturbance
senses.ex: They studied the relaxation time of the magnetic field in the laboratory.

Tips.title: Scientific Concept
Tips.description: In science, it is a specific process, not to be confused with resting.
Tips.example: Nuclear magnetic resonance involves measuring spin-lattice relaxation.

Tips.title: Academic Language
Tips.description: Used in technical discussions, not casual conversation.
Tips.example: Her lecture covered electron relaxation phenomena in semiconductors.

Calm.wordDefinition:
Calm implies a state of peace and tranquility in one's mind or emotions.

It's a feeling of being composed and untroubled. Calmness can come in any situation regardless of being in a relaxed or active state.

Calm is applicable when we need clarity of mind and want to stay composed.

Ease.wordDefinition:
Ease refers to the state of being comfortable, free from pain or trouble, or without difficulty.

It is often used to describe a situation where something is made easier or more comfortable to do. For example, a soft cushion can ease the pain in your back, or taking a break can ease the stress you feel.

Ease refers to making something easier or more comfortable, while relaxation refers to the state of being mentally and physically calm and free from stress.

Both words are applicable in different scenarios - ease to remove discomfort or difficulties, and relaxation to find peace and calmness.

Leisure.wordDefinition:
Leisure refers to the time that you have free from work, study or obligations. It is the time when you can engage yourself in the activities you like, such as hobbies, sports, and entertainment.

It can be achieved during leisure time or even while working.

Leisure is a period of time when you can engage in enjoyable activities while relaxation is a state of being calm and free of stress.

Leisure time can be used for relaxation, but relaxation can also be done at any time during the day.

Refreshment.wordDefinition:
Refreshment refers to something that rejuvenates your energy or makes you feel more awake and alert. This could be a cold drink on a hot day or a short break from work to clear your mind.

Refreshment is applicable when you need to re-energize yourself and regain focus.

Refreshment is about restoring energy and focus while relaxation is about calming the mind and body. Depending on the situation, one may be more applicable than the other.

Rejuvenate.wordDefinition:
Rejuvenate means to restore something to its original or youthful state.

Both words are applicable in different circumstances. For example, if you're feeling tired and sluggish after a long day at school, going for a run or doing some yoga might rejuvenate you and bring back your energy.

Repose.wordDefinition:
Repose refers to a state of rest or tranquility, either physical or mental. It often implies a period of inactivity or withdrawal from the demands of daily life.

For example, lying down on a comfortable surface and taking a nap can help you find repose.

In a nutshell, relaxation refers to the process of relieving tension or anxiety, while repose refers to the state of being at rest or at peace.

Rest.wordDefinition:
Rest means to cease activities and take a break, giving our body and mind a chance to recover and rejuvenate.

It usually involves activities such as sleeping, lying down or sitting, and watching TV. We use rest as a way to recharge our batteries, feel energized, and ready to take on activities again.

Relaxation helps us release stress and feel peaceful, while rest helps us recover and revitalize our body and mind. Both are important to maintain a healthy lifestyle.

Tranquil.wordDefinition:
Tranquil refers to a peaceful and serene environment. It describes a place or situation that is free from disturbance, noise, or chaos.

Tranquil surroundings can include a calm lake, a quiet library or a silent forest.

Relaxation is applicable to a person's mood or state of mind while tranquil is applicable to a place or situation that is peaceful or serene.

quotes.Text: We all strive for balance, often moving to extremes to find ourselves somewhere in the middle where we can sustainably exist in optimal inspiration. Working toward balance takes a lot of ingredients. We need courage, reflection, attention, action, and a push-and-pull relationship between effort and relaxation.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Tara Stiles

quotes.Text: I like sports, and swimming is my favorite. Doing physical exercises keeps one fit and healthy and helps one work more efficiently. I think we all need to strike a balance between work and relaxation. This can keep us energetic and help us do our job better.
quotes.Title: Chinese Politician
quotes.Name: Xi Jinping

quotes.Text: There is an atmosphere about the picture theatre that speaks of entertainment and relaxation. The charming surroundings, good music, and the fact that each visitor is determined to enjoy a few hours of holiday all exert an influence on the mind.
quotes.Title: Welsh Musician
quotes.Name: Ivor Novello

quotes.Text: Thus we hope to teach mythology not as a study, but as a relaxation from study; to give our work the charm of a story-book, yet by means of it to impart a knowledge of an important branch of education.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Thomas Bulfinch

quotes.Text: I genuinely treasure my friends, they are my real support... What I get from them is big support, relief and relaxation as we meet every day to play cards.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Jeetendra

quotes.Text: Reduce the stress levels in your life through relaxation techniques like meditation, deep breathing, and exercise. You'll look and feel way better for it.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Suzanne Somers

quotes.Text: Walking is my main method of relaxation. I don't go over my lines or try to solve the world's problems, I just enjoy the scenery and the wildlife.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Kevin Whately

quotes.Text: The gigantic tension before the shooting of an arrow, and the total relaxation seconds later, is my way of connecting to the universe.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Novelist
quotes.Name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.Text: A cheerful frame of mind, reinforced by relaxation... is the medicine that puts all ghosts of fear on the run.
quotes.Title: American Editor
quotes.Name: George Matthew Adams

quotes.Text: True relaxation, which would do me the world of good, does not exist for me.
quotes.Title: Austrian Artist
quotes.Name: Gustav Klimt
